title: Police perform acrobatic stunts during Mexican parade
description: Police pulled off some acrobatic stunts on motorcycles during a Revolution Day Parade in Mexico. The country celebrated its 1910 revolution last month on November 20. #acrobatics #police #parade #mexicotiktok Patricia Salinas Garcia via Storyful

title: Alex Volkanovski to headline Sydney UFC event in February
description: Alex Volkanovski is the headline act for the UFC's return to Sydney in February. He'll defend his featherweight title in a rematch against Diego Lopes. #alexvolkanovski #diegolopes #ufc #mma #combatsports

title: Hit-and-run driver strikes multiple cars in Perth | 7NEWS
description: A hit-and-run driver in a Mazda struck multiple vehicles on Wypris Road in Camillo, Perth, before fleeing the scene. Nicole George, 47, was driving her Mitsubishi Outlander just metres from her home when she was hit by the ute, which then struck a parked Audi and damaged a fence before the driver abandoned the vehicle and escaped. Police are seeking information from witnesses as the investigation continues. title: First Nazi salute convictions under new WA laws | 7NEWS
description: Two men received fines after being sentenced under Western Australia's new Nazi salute laws in the first court cases testing the legislation. Daniel Stocks, 36, was fined $1,800 for performing five Heil Hitler salutes and making racist slurs in a Perth pub following an anti-immigration rally, while Samuel William Kroll, 21, received fines and a suspended sentence for racially harassing Jewish people and assaulting a police officer. title: Family escapes devastating Maddington house fire | 7NEWS
description: A mother and her three young children escaped a devastating house fire in Maddington by breaking through their neighbour's fence after flames engulfed their home within minutes. The family was treated for smoke inhalation at Armidale Hospital, while fire crews battled the suspicious blaze that started in the carport and destroyed the property. Police arson squad investigators are examining the cause of the fire, which occurred just two weeks before Christmas as the family was preparing to move out. title: The Trump administration has announced new tourism rules
description: The Trump administration has announced new tourism rules requiring travellers from visa-exempt countries including Australia, New Zealand, and Britain to provide five years of social media history before entry. The changes would make social media data submission compulsory for ESTA applications. #UnitedStates #travel #visa #socialmedia #socialmediaban

title: People critically injured in three-car crash
description: A three-car crash on the Hume Highway at Liverpool has left two people in critical conditions. #crash #hospital #carcrash #sydney #liverpool

title: Qld to reduce minimum age for ankle monitors
description: The Queensland Government is set to introduce new ankle monitor laws, reducing the minimum age from 15 to 10 as part of the state's youth crime crackdown. #anklemonitor #crime #youthcrime #queensland #qld

title: Thai military releases footage of drone attack
description: The Thai military has released footage of a drone strike on a Cambodian target, as conflict along the border between the two countries continues. #drone #thailand #cambodia #border #military

title: Multiple people dead after buildings collapse in Morocco
description: At least 22 people have been killed and more than a dozen injured after two buildings suddenly collapsed in north-eastern Morocco. #collapse #morocco #news #worldnews #africa

title: 'Nintendo Man': The incredible story of turning gaming passion into a career | 7NEWS VAULT
description: Dave Elsley transformed his passion for Nintendo video games into a career by creating a free advisory service for customers in Australian toy stores in 1991. After months of unemployment, he developed expertise in Nintendo games, approached stores with his service proposal, and successfully demonstrated its value when one store sold out of games during his first demonstration. Elsley later established his own hotline service to compete with Mattel's Nintendo helpline, turning his gaming enthusiasm into full-time employment.
